column4: ug, apparently in reinstalling my nvidia driver i lost my sound
it took me almost 2 weeks to get my sound working last time
yea
but i dunno, all i know is my sound no longer works
sometimes you can use alsaconf to correct sound card issues
you can always download alsacaonf
do a search for alsa
you run alsaconf as root from a separate login window before you log in to X (that's how I do it, and it gives me less problems)
let me check the net for a sec
I use alsaconf on debian 3.1 on my p4 box, but it may be deprecated.
have you tried setting volume controls?
hmmm...have you tried rebooting the x server?
sometimes x will do weird things.
x can affect many things on occasion
ya...weird
linux modules can be touchy at times
how would i check to see if any modules were effected?
a quick and dirty fix would be to download and install everything with alsa in the title ;)
I still think alsaconf should be there
you need to do "su alsaconf" for it to work

if alsa-utils package is installed, try /usr/bin/alsaconf directly
